p: To simulate grain yield, the Hybrid-Maize model requires input for daily total solar radiation, maximum and minimum temperature, and evapotranspiration. Other model inputs include each variety’s GDD (GDD at silking and maturity), date of planting, and plant population density. In this study, the real sowing dates for varieties used in the 1980s and 2000s varieties ( Supplementary Table S2) and plant population densities (60,000 plants ha −1 at all stations) were used in the simulation for both rainfed and irrigated maize with varieties from both the 1980s and 2000s. The change in atmospheric CO 2 level since the 1980s has not been taken into account in the simulation because the Hybrid-Maize model does not consider CO 2 changes.
